history.content: Summarize the stages of the tasks we want to accomplish

Dr. Juan B. Gutiérrez, here is a concise overview of the stages we aim to accomplish:

1. Data Acquisition and QC  
   • Gather transcriptomics, metabolomics, proteomics, and clinical data.  
   • Perform basic quality checks and normalization (e.g., filtering genes, handling missing metabolite data, median-normalizing proteomics signals).

2. Cross-Species Harmonization  
   • Use Ensembl BioMart to map one-to-one gene orthologs between Macaca mulatta and Macaca fascicularis.  
   • Exclude any genes without direct one-to-one orthologs or with complex mappings.

3. Multi-Omic Integration  
   • Integrate transcriptomic, metabolomic, proteomic, and clinical information.  
   • Apply multivariate methods (DIABLO or pairwise PLS) to identify key signals that distinguish susceptible vs resilient host responses.

4. Pathway and Phase-Stratified Interpretation  
   • Examine functional pathways (e.g., KEGG, Reactome) and identify influences of different infection phases.  
   • Correlate identified modules with parasitemia and hematological measures.

5. Visualization and Reporting  
   • Produce QC plots, differential expression plots (volcano, PCA), heatmaps, and network diagrams.  
   • Provide a thorough written report, metadata files, and reproducible code/scripts.
